rules.ruleString: Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {HSC1061, PHH1061}

unitName: Analysing patterns of health and disease
description: This unit provides an introduction to epidemiological and statistical concepts necessary for understanding patterns of health and disease in populations. It extends the overview provided in PHH1061, reviewing how health and disease are measured, and how patterns of health and disease in populations are investigated. Students are introduced to different study designs, analysing and interpreting health data and the concepts of bias and confounding. Case studies include local, national and global examples of epidemiological research.
faculty: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences
